page.title: 09ANIMAL REARING NEAR SEISDON
page.content: So far as animal husbandry is concerned most farmers seem to keep some stock. Traditionally this has been a dairy cattle area, but with the necessity of cutting down milk quotas under E.E.C. farming regulations there has been a swing to the fattening of beef cattle, though some farmers still keep one or two dairy cows. Pastureland mostly provides good grazing for cattle and though there are a few poorer areas these are quite small and restricted, usually on badly- drained or hilly ground. A few large flocks of sheep are to be seen, but this is not really a sheep-farming area.
